Grand trip across the plains — 
May Thurs. 19th, 1859
5 miles 
Crossed the Missouri a very muddy stream with a fast current containing a good deal of float wood
Omaha quite a city took sketch of the capitol camped on a small creek---feel fine--distance 5 miles
15" Fri 20th
Had an awful rain last night although I was in a tent but that leaked & you better believe we got a ducking.
Kate & the Snowden boys got washed out--camped on a small run Dis 10m
21" Sat 21st
Passed through Elkhorn a small dwarfish looking place rather squatty. crossed the Elkhorn river a stream hardly worthy the name caped on its banks & prepared our fabric ? -- saw a few indians one squaw had arms as large as my leg 6

May
3 
-37-Sunday 22d
Was the luck to lose my sketch book with several pictures in & other trinkets  passed paunee Village pop 3500 Indians it situated just below Fremont on the oposite side of the river (Platte) I stoped behind the train to purchace some moggasions one large 6 ft indian took my knife off of the my belt to look at it & would not give it up I pounch him & took it by main strength & being barefooted had to make use of my legs as they all (some 15 or more) took after me but I out ran them & lucky for me for what they would have done dont know. passed through Fremont only just staked out another facsimile of Elkhorn camped by a slough found a beautiful flower a species of the pea  Distance 16mi
Monday 23d
Very pleasant today met 34 teams of returning Pike’s Peakers Pikes Peak or bust Pikes Peak going & coming did you ever see the like
a09ca2c3c8d857f30baf44d7098f7d20.jpg

4
us boys invented a parady on the song Jordon
"I looked to the west & I looked to the east
& I spied the pikes pearkers a coming
some on horseback some on foot & some a running" tc
Camped on the Plate river Here we stand for the first time on the banks of the Platte Tis now sunsett & on of the most beautiful scenes I ever saw the sun appears to be sinking in the river pity the sun should dip in muddy stream-- the river is lined with beautiful shade trees the river is shallow the bed is quicksand there seems to be no grade but the current is very rapid country very level except the distant sand hills took a bath this even in platte Dis--20 mis
Tues 24th
77"
Still pleasant passed through Columbus a decent little town camped on the Platte got kicked head over heals trying 25 milk a wild cow wind raising some signs of a blow drove stakes & fasend our wagons & tents ready for it. dis--20
3e27974265f246cadaa759dfdc9d3d43.jpg

May Wed 25th
89"
cold cloudy & raining our blow came off & just sent things tents & such like but it didn't do us much harm camped away from the P. on our way to the crossing of Loupe fork couple of the boys had a friight hatchets drawn but nobody "kildt" still raining Dis 12
92" Thurs 26
Cold & raining started for a new camp drove 3 miles & stoped on Looking Glass creek in sight of Monroe--went hunting came to the Loupe Fork but no game here a few deer tracks & that's all went back & fished a little a splendid time herding cattle if a fellow only thought so Dis 3 mis
Fri 27th
99" passed through the city of Genoa a morman settlement had a grand old swim taking our cattle across current rather stiff had to waid half a day before we could get our wagons across on account of the crowd camped on the oposite side of Loupe F 7
f4ab8f1a3bf35aa08168bed326a55b4d.jpg

May
120" Sat 28th
Camped in the woods last night -as we left the river we came [to] a poor [sandy] country - saw some antelope some of the company saw elk [wolves] & fozes [lied to ?] but - we now [?] slaved camped on the blugg of the Loup fo 1/2 [mil ?]  went - Elf hunting in the timber but - [?] took a [?] in the Loup - i - [?] 21st
Sun 29th
125
Went 10 miles after our [oxen] found them all right - camped [?] lay over till [?day] after  as - [?] - drive took a good wash & swim in Loup -[rained] this the evening tis [?]
Mon - 30th
149"
This morning we [foned] ourselves into a company [of] wagons 21 men 5 women 4 children [?] 50 cattle framed a code of [?] laws or constitution & by majority of vote Mr. [?] Burr was elected captain - went- antelope hunting [?] a splendid shot but - my gun [hung fir] & [?] my "honey saw 174 antelope & 1 wolf camped on dry land 24
d443cfa39d0674b8b5e52138a3ee4f07.jpg

May
Tues 31st
165"
Cool & pleasant wind [?] high finaly we have reached the long [wisha] for [Baire creek] a clean & beautiful stream gracious what a good thing watetr is campid in a good place feel good - took a bath - tis 16-
Wed June 1st
185
Folloed the Baire creek several miles crossed over to wood river went hunting found an eagles next this country has been a great buffalo range on  [acewud] of the buffalo [chips] found prickly pear a species of the cactus [today] camped on wood [R?20]
Thurs 2d
197"
Crossed the river run off the ridge broke an ex in the operation [unloded] chains into the wheel got some timber & made a new one passed through [Nury] a  [liking ?] place for a year old camped on the banks of Plath & [?]  [go or 40]  buffalo neare [oposite] [? Keany]  or a mile above [ks /2miles]

June 8
201" Friday 3rd 
Myself with 2 others crossed the river 
twas cold  & windy & I never suffered more 
in my life in crossing of us Nate
came near drowning - the south side of 
[[Platte] (Platte River Nebraska)] a hard looking hole alkali? & 
no feed? Uncle Sams boys looked quite?
unclear in their uniforms with their [pop?] guns a few cannon standing on wagons in the plaza was all I saw of note.
36fe3f3de2a57f9e321e6f91cda491d6.jpg

9 June
[Twasnt?] tough nor any thing unclear
none of it was swallowed for all [we?]
chewed it - 1/2 hour some of our 
company have killed another and have
gone after it with 8 oxen PM - here
comes the buffalo he stands 7 ft high
head weighs 200 lbs when his breast bone
was split - he measures 14 1/2 ft from foot to foot
we skinned? him and took the best of the 
meat to jerk? drove on untill we
came to wood and jerked it saw thousands
of the buffalo in every direction unclear
227" Sunday S
Still day and pleasant - lots of
alkali? Prickely pears and c -- just unclear
a fellow that is barefooted and driving
loose cows and lame oxen -- camper? oer?
a nice creek took a swim in
a beaver's dam excellent spring water
feed unclear buffalo chips timber getting?
scarer we are quite a little ways
from Platte unclear 16-
7f3d266f5429b4bc72b374a9cd4e32c5.jpg

June
Monday, 6th
236
Made an addition of 5 men in our 
company their cattle & wagons - drove 
9 miles camped (to bake as there is 
no wood for 200 miles above here)
on Buffalo Creek the same creek we 
unclear on last - had to feel of 
several heads as I am called our 
phrenologist, some i never saw before
as it was after dark so I had to go 
all by feeling they said I done it up 
right & all I saw was unclear good satisfaction
the earth dry & barren - Gis? (Is this his signature?)
Tuesday 7th
254
Pheasant drove to Platte Fort camped & took 
a swim & ran for 3 races & beat unclear
unclear of alkali - Gis?
a765812bbd21340b3fade3fa78f8d318.jpg

Thurs 9th June [1894?]
.. left the river went over some sand 
hills came to [Paumee] Springs they look 
as beautiful a stream as large as a 
bucket from one besides several others 
close by not quite as large crossed two 
fine creeks camped on the banks of old Platte.
Dis 20
Fri 10th
9 miles to Black Mud Creek 14 miles 
to North Bluff North of Platte 6 rods

wide 12 inches deep clear as a crystal. 

No [wood] - camped, took a bath; 
had to watch tonight as it’s my 
turn perhaps the milk and biscuit 
didn’t suffer about 12 (o’clock). 
Dis 23 m 
Sat 11th
9 miles to Elk Creek a fine [spring] 
1/4 mile north of road 4 miles to Shepherds 
Creek 2 miles to Wolf Springs. 
Camped water very good.
Dis 15
58cc485a3ccf49c78cce5766f48fb0f1.jpg

Sun June 12th
332
Mild & pleasant laid over here until Monday took a swim washed my shirt had my head shaved to save the trouble of combing & for comfort - had a firm catch of mild green peas ()
3.3.2"
Mond 13th
Passed several creeks which were very clear & cold camped on Platter 3 miles this side of Rallesmake Rim on the opposite side of Platter are to be seen ridges of rock & cedars quite armantic for the season.
Dis 20
368"
Tues 14th
Had an awful time fighting cusquitoes last night built a smudge & drove myself out of the tent instead of the musquitoes.  Pattersons {  } in crossing a muddy creek in next the [} mile - the muddy mater head first one of their famled had a tall time getting out - camped on Platter had to go 5 miles ahead for the cows & after dark at that.
Dis 16

13    June

    Wed 15th

386
Passed ask Hollow crossed Castle river oposit A.H. Ask H is on the South side of Plalle a remarkable place in history  Camped on Plalle            Dis 18
406            Thurs 16th
Crossed a large creek at noon  passed over Land hills near indian { } Law an indian burying ground  A lot of skulls placed around in a circle all facing in Camped at the foot of Ancient bluff Ruins discovered 3 new flowers - my match is night.        Dis 26
424    Fri 17th
Visited the ruins they are about 300ft high or more [ ] them can be seen the Courthouse Rock, Chimney Rock & other memoriall things  Campers on Platter R. opposite  C. { } Rock  This rock is sightly named for it reminds on of a courthouse - even if knew and the name it is about 200 fat [  ].              Dis  18
